column4: Ubuntu says that KPPP isn't compatible? Why is ti doing this?
tell us what you are doing, exactly.
don't you have a ppp implementation that you can use in the package manager?
there is certainly support for ppp.
If i do, i have no clue where it is, I jsut got my discs in the mail today
yes, I saw it the first time.
where did you get kppp from?

sorry for seeming rude, just a little crazy in here, i was trying to access it from the ubuntu disc, but the system is trying to access the internet. catch 22, it can't connect to the internet without the kppp which it needs to connect to get. blows the mind!
yes, but I'm confused.  why kppp?  are you using kde?
honestly, im not sure, im using whatever the default ubuntu setup is using
unless you have the kubuntu cd rather than the ubuntu cd
so i jsut switch it and then im golden, I know where to change from KDE to GNOME
try it, hopefully the gnome installation doesn't have this circular dependency bug
thanks, im going to go try that now, hopefully I won't be back ;-)
